messages.message:
For some reason, I’m seeing different data in dogfood vs localhost? I don’t have local db set up. Any thoughts?
FYI, I deleted test_user4 in dogfood and maybe it takes a while to populate the change to localhost?
I also delete test_user4 in localhost a bit after, but it keeps popping up even after a successful deletion

URL: https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/admin/spaces/uat-test-space/uat-test-subspace
the changes should propagate immediately since both dogfood and your local env are using the same dbs, but it’s possible that something is getting cached in redis in your local env
Ok. Let me try restarting redis
yup correct, only the db and file-system are shared. other persistent storage services like redis, rabbitMQ, PV’s, elastic-search are isolated so you have to restart those in each env.
Ok. After recompiling and restarting redis, it was working as expected. I’ll keep an eye on this issue and see if this pops up again
